revised_title: Investigations on the Electric Discharge with the Chloride of Silver Battery
tldr: Drs. De La Rue and H. W. Müller investigate the electric discharge using a chloride of silver battery and a bell-jar. They study the resistance, pressure, and potential required to produce a discharge in various gases, such as air, hydrogen, and carbonic acid. The authors also observe a sudden expansion of gas when the terminals are connected to the battery, which they attribute to an increase in pressure rather than temperature.
